definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: Glances with a smile at the worm-eaten crowns, and if he happens to be.
sentences.chinese: 他帶着微笑望了望那些蟲蛀了的皇冠。

sentences.english: She smiled, and then went away to fetch herself a flea-bitten fur coat.
sentences.chinese: 她微笑着，然後走開去拿她自己那件被蟲蛀的皮大衣。

sentences.english: His winter suit has been badly wormed.
sentences.chinese: 他的冬衣被蟲蛀得一塌糊塗。

sentences.english: The worms have already eaten off some pages of that old book.
sentences.chinese: 那本古書有幾頁已被蟲蛀壞了。

sentences.english: Therefore will I be unto Ephraim as a moth, and to the house of Judah as rottenness.
sentences.chinese: 我使以法蓮如蟲蛀之物，使猶大家如朽爛之木。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to win by a surprise move
to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to whisper to one another's ear
